name: Vargas
description: Vargas claimed that mutants are deviations from the norm, an evolutionary dead end nature explored until it found the true path for the next step in mutant kinds development, the legitimate Homo Sapiens Superior, namely, himself.

items.name: While I Live, You Don't Die !

wiki.powers: Vargas’ super powers are still a mystery and have never been fully explained. Vargas is not a [[Glossary:M#mutant|mutant]], but is not fully [[Humans|human]] either. According to Vargas, he is mankind’s response to mutant-kind. He claims to be a real super “human” (as opposed to having powers caused by [[Glossary:G#genetic|genetic]] [[Glossary:M#mutation|mutation]]) and also claims he is the pure and legitimate Homo sapiens superior. He possesses [[Glossary:S#superhuman|superhuman]] strength (even for a mutant) and speed and has genius-level intellect. He also possesses superhuman reflexes, agility, stamina, and durability. He is a master swordsman and martial artist. [[Rogue|Rogue’s]] absorption powers were ineffective against Vargas as well.
wiki.significant_issues: [[OHOTMU:Bibliography-AZ12#Vargas|Official Handbook Bibliography]]; killed by the Marauders (X-Men #202, 2007)
wiki.bio_text: Always accompanied by the deadly twin warriors [[Thais]] and [[Thaiis]], Vargas claimed that [[mutants]] are deviations from the norm, an evolutionary dead end nature explored until it found the true path for the next step in mutant kinds development, the legitimate [[Glossary:H#Homo sapiens superior|Homo Sapiens Superior]] - Vargas. Believing mutants are obsolete and must make way for [[Earth]]'s true inheritors, Vargas seemed determined to remove them personally, one at a time. Learning the X-Men were in Spain seeking [[Destiny (Irene Adler)|Destiny]]'s prophetic diaries, Vargas sought the diaries for himself. During a hostile confrontation with [[Rogue]], [[Psylocke]], and the [[Beast (Henry McCoy)|Beast]] in the Spanish Action Forces's base, Vargas informed them he had only come for one of them. Accepting a challenge from Psylocke, he slew her with ease, saying she was the first but not the last. [[image:Vargas.jpg|thumb|Vargas vs Rogue|left]] Soon after, having located the diary, Vargas stole it from Destiny's house. When [[Gambit]] subsequently broke into Vargas' home, Vargas spared his life on a whim. Disturbed to read in the diary that Rogue would slay him, Vargas resolved to deny this destiny and faced her in [[Madripoor]]. Initially Vargas had the upper hand, but Rogue gradually absorbed his abilities each time he struck her until she was his equal, his superior considering her other powers. Poised to slay Vargas, Rogue hesitated, unsure she wished to be bound by the future Destiny had foretold. Rogue Spared Vargas in order to break the future the diaries had fortold, thus illegitamizing them.
wiki.bio:
Always accompanied by the deadly twin warriors [[Thais]] and [[Thaiis]], Vargas claimed that [[mutants]] are deviations from the norm, an evolutionary dead end nature explored until it found the true path for the next step in mutant kinds development, the legitimate [[Glossary:H#Homo sapiens superior|Homo Sapiens Superior]] - Vargas. Believing mutants are obsolete and must make way for [[Earth]]'s true inheritors, Vargas seemed determined to remove them personally, one at a time. Learning the X-Men were in Spain seeking [[Destiny (Irene Adler)|Destiny]]'s prophetic diaries, Vargas sought the diaries for himself. During a hostile confrontation with [[Rogue]], [[Psylocke]], and the [[Beast (Henry McCoy)|Beast]] in the Spanish Action Forces's base, Vargas informed them he had only come for one of them. Accepting a challenge from Psylocke, he slew her with ease, saying she was the first but not the last. [[image:Vargas.jpg|thumb|Vargas vs Rogue|left]] Soon after, having located the diary, Vargas stole it from Destiny's house. When [[Gambit]] subsequently broke into Vargas' home, Vargas spared his life on a whim. Disturbed to read in the diary that Rogue would slay him, Vargas resolved to deny this destiny and faced her in [[Madripoor]]. Initially Vargas had the upper hand, but Rogue gradually absorbed his abilities each time he struck her until she was his equal, his superior considering her other powers. Poised to slay Vargas, Rogue hesitated, unsure she wished to be bound by the future Destiny had foretold. Rogue Spared Vargas in order to break the future the diaries had fortold, thus illegitamizing them.

Vargas was murdered by the Sinisters Marauders just before Messiah Complex as part of his attempt to prevent anyone from himself predicting the birth of Hope.
